lead_paragraph: The former major leaguer José Offerman will serve two years of a special form of probation for attacking two players with a bat during a minor league game in August. Bridgeport (Conn.) Superior Court Judge James Ginocchio granted Offerman, a two-time All-Star, accelerated rehabilitation after hearing from current and former major league players supporting Offerman. Two felony assault charges will be erased from his record if he abides by the terms of the probation.
